div.span: Holley CSD is Closed Due to Coronavirus Pandemic
Holley Central School District is currently closed due to COVID-19 pandemic restrictions. For more information on updates, services and resources during closure, visit our COVID-19 Information page.
Please review the information available below and at right regarding the school closure during the COVID-19 pandemic.

a.onclick: ga('send', 'event', 'URL', 'Link', 'COVID-19 Update - April 17 - Extension of School Closure Through May 15');

div.a: COVID-19 Update - April 17 - Extension of School Closure Through May 15

div.a: Message from the Superintendent on March 16

div.a: Important Information for Families During School Closure

a.onclick: ga('send', 'event', 'URL', 'Link', 'Holley Central School District is Closed Beginning March 16');

div.a: Holley Central School District is Closed Beginning March 16

span.div: Starting Monday, April 27, Holley CSD is providing free “grab and go” meals (breakfast and lunch) to all children ages 18 and younger that reside in the district. This food distribution plan will continue for the duration that schools are closed. Breakfast and lunch meals will both be available Mondays, Wednesdays and Fridays for pick-up from 8-10 a.m. each day, at five distribution locations. The sites are as follows:

ul.li: County Line Trailer Park (Gulf Rd/Countyline Rd)

span.div:
Look for the Holley school bus at each site. Staff will be there to assist. Each child, age 0-18, will have two breakfast bags and two lunch bags distributed on Mondays and Wednesdays, and one breakfast bag and one lunch bag distributed on Fridays.
Children that are not yet enrolled in school are eligible for this program. Students do not need to be receiving a free and reduced meal in order to be eligible for this program; all students are eligible to receive meals through this distribution program.
If you have any questions or concerns about access food for your children, please contact your child's school or call our food service director, Vickie Scroger at (585) 638-6318 x2566.

div.span: The links below provide more information about the cancellation of Regents Exams, course credits and graduation requirements from the New York State Education Department (NYSED) website.

a.onclick: ga('send', 'event', 'URL', 'Link', 'Regents Exams Cancellation NYSED Guidance Document');

div.a: Regents Exams Cancellation NYSED Guidance Document

div.span: Provides links to K-12 technology resources for parents and students to work on assignments as well as provides links to additional resources that can be accessed from home.
